problem_text: 21.93. (M. Herzog, J. Sch¨onheim). Let G be a group and let k ⩾ 2. Let H1, . . . , Hk be subgroups of G, and g1, . . . , gk elements of G such that the cosets g1H1, . . . , gkHk form a partition of G. Is it true that |G : Hi| = |G : Hj| for some i ̸= j? This is known to be true for groups with a Sylow tower (M. A. Berger, A. Felzenbaum, A. Fraenkel, Fund. Math., 128, no. 3 (1987), 139–144). Also cf. 20.99. L. Margolis
